Package Controller

Class ScreenHandler

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
Controller.ScreenHandler
public class ScreenHandler
extends javafx.application.Application
Class used to contain all the FXML files in an ArrayList in order to switch between screens using a static method. All the Controllers linked to the screens will be contained in a Array of Controllers and their update method will be called whenever we change screen.

  • Nested Class Summary

  • Method Details

    • changeScene

      public static void changeScene​(int idScene)
      changeScene is a static function and will be used by other object such as Controller in order to change the root of the active scene.
      Parameters:
      idScene - this is an int and it is used to choose which screen will be displayed.(Refer to the list above)

    • addScene

      private void addScene​(java.lang.String scenePath)
      Method used to add a fxml file to the ArrayList and add the Controller link to that fxml in the ArrayList of Controller.
      Parameters:
      scenePath - String containing the path of the fxml file that will be loaded.

    • start

      public void start​(javafx.stage.Stage stage) throws java.lang.Exception
      At first, start() adds all scenes to screens attribute.
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      stage - Stage for the application.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - If all scenes were not successfully added to the stage.

    • createAccountCreationPopup

      public void createAccountCreationPopup​(java.lang.String message, boolean success)
      Creates a popup stage when account creation has been attempted to inform user.
      Parameters:
      message - message to display to user
      success - defines if account creation was successful or not

    • tcuWindow

      public void tcuWindow() throws java.io.IOException
      Creates a pop-up window when user clicks on "I accept terms and conditions".
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when terms and conditions file doesn't exist.
